w:r.w:t: AI Image Generation · Image Editing · Short Video Clips · Template Library · Personal Gallery · Credit System

This PRD covers Phase 1 (MVP) only — Months 1 through 6. Phase 2 features (Character Consistency, Brand Kit, AI Voiceover, Style Training, Mobile App) are explicitly out of scope and must not be built or half-built in this phase. Any scope creep must be flagged and approved before implementation.
Initial PRD created. All Phase 1 features defined.

This Product Requirements Document (PRD) defines, in exhaustive detail, every feature, user story, acceptance criterion, API endpoint, data model, error state, and non-functional requirement for the Phase 1 MVP of CreativeAI — a bootstrapped, consumer-first AI creative studio SaaS.

The goal is to provide developers, designers, and QA with a single authoritative reference that eliminates ambiguity and leaves no room for interpretation errors during implementation. Every decision documented here has been made deliberately; deviations require explicit written approval from the Product Owner.

CreativeAI is an all-in-one AI creative studio designed exclusively for individual creators — hobbyists, students, side-hustlers, and casual makers. The core promise: generate stunning AI images, make short video clips, edit photos, and access curated templates — all in a single browser tab, with zero learning curve, at $5–$19/month.
Time-to-first-creation: A brand-new user who signs up for the free tier must be able to generate their first AI image within 90 seconds of account creation, with no tutorial required.
The following six feature areas comprise the full Phase 1 MVP. Each is covered in its own dedicated section below:

In addition, Sections 2 and 9–13 cover cross-cutting concerns: Authentication, User Accounts, Design System, Technical Architecture, API Specifications, Non-Functional Requirements, and Testing Strategy.

The following features are documented in the Business Plan as Phase 2 and must NOT be built in Phase 1: Character Consistency Engine, Brand Kit, AI Voiceover Generator, Personal Style Training (LoRA), Mobile App (iOS/Android), Team/collaboration features, Social sharing feed, API access for developers, White-label offering.
A single AI model inference call that produces one or more images or video clips
The internal currency unit consumed when a user triggers a generation or editing action
Credits that are unused at end of billing period and carry forward to the next month
A semi-transparent CreativeAI logo overlay applied to outputs of Free tier users
A pre-configured set of model parameters (negative prompts, guidance, style LoRA) exposed as a named button
A pre-designed prompt + aspect ratio + style preset combination that can be applied with one click
The user's personal cloud storage of all past generations, accessible and re-downloadable at any time
AI technique for selectively replacing a masked region of an image with AI-generated content
AI enhancement technique that increases image resolution while improving detail and sharpness
The user's subscription level: Free, Spark ($5/mo), Glow ($12/mo), or Pro ($19/mo)
Must have — product is broken without it
Should have — critical for user satisfaction at launch
Nice to have — improves experience but not launch-blocking
Application Programming Interface — the backend REST endpoints served to the frontend
Content Delivery Network — used for serving generated media assets globally
Authentication is handled by Supabase Auth. The following sign-in methods must be supported at launch:
Standard email/password registration with email verification link sent on sign-up
One-click sign-in via Google account; no password required
User enters email; receives a one-time sign-in link valid for 10 minutes
The registration flow must be designed to minimize friction. The sequence is:
User clicks 'Get Started Free' on the landing page or 'Sign Up' in the app header
Modal or dedicated page presents three auth options: Google (primary CTA), Email/Password, Magic Link
On Google OAuth: redirect to Google consent screen → redirect back → account created → onboarding flow starts
On Email/Password: user enters email + password (min 8 chars) → verification email sent → user lands on 'Check your email' screen → clicks link → account activated → onboarding flow starts
On Magic Link: user enters email → magic link sent → 'Check your email' screen → user clicks link → account created/signed-in → onboarding flow starts
No credit card is required at registration. The Free tier must be instantly accessible with zero payment friction. Asking for payment before the user has experienced value is explicitly prohibited.
Every new user must experience a 3-step onboarding flow immediately after account creation. This flow cannot be skipped on first login but can be dismissed midway (user lands on dashboard).
Single large animation showing image being generated. Tagline: 'Turn your ideas into stunning visuals in seconds.'
6 style preset cards shown (Photorealistic, Anime, Digital Art, Oil Painting, Cinematic, Watercolor). User taps one to select. Selection saved to profile.
You're ready! Here are your free credits
Animated credit counter counting up to 25. Brief explanation: 'Each image costs 1 credit. Credits refresh monthly. No card needed.'
The 'users' table in Supabase (extends Supabase Auth's auth.users):
Primary key — matches Supabase Auth user ID
Public display name; defaults to email prefix
Profile picture URL; auto-populated from Google OAuth if available
Current available credits; never goes below 0
Credits granted at each billing cycle based on plan
Accumulated unused credits from previous billing cycles
Start date of current billing period; null for free users
Stripe customer ID; null until first payment attempt
Active Stripe subscription ID; null for free users
User's default style preset selected during onboarding
Whether the user has completed or dismissed the onboarding flow
Last activity timestamp; updated on each API call
Accessible via avatar menu → 'Account Settings'. Must include:
Display name (editable text field, max 40 chars)
Email address (read-only if Google OAuth; editable otherwise — requires re-verification)
Password change (only for email/password accounts; requires current password)
Subscription plan display (current plan name, renewal date, 'Manage / Upgrade' CTA linking to billing portal)
Credit balance display (remaining credits + rollover balance)
Delete account (requires typing 'DELETE' to confirm; soft-deletes; sends confirmation email; all data deleted after 30-day grace period)

Users type a text prompt, choose a style preset and aspect ratio, and the system returns one AI-generated image using the selected model. Generation consumes credits. Free tier outputs carry a watermark.
The Image Generation screen is the primary home screen of the application. Layout (desktop, left-to-right):
Left panel (320px, fixed): Prompt input, Style preset selector, Aspect ratio selector, Advanced options accordion (collapsed by default), Generate button, Credit cost indicator
Right panel (fluid): Output display area — shows the generated image; before first generation shows an animated placeholder with example prompts
Mobile layout: vertically stacked — prompt and controls above, output below. Generate button is sticky at the bottom of the viewport.
Multi-line textarea, min 2 rows, auto-expands up to 6 rows
Maximum 500 characters; live character counter shown (e.g., '142 / 500')
Rotating examples every 4 seconds: 'A golden retriever in a coffee shop, watercolor style' / 'Cyberpunk city at night, neon reflections' / 'Portrait of a woman in Renaissance style'

A subtle toggle labeled '✨ Enhance prompt' — when ON, the system appends quality-boosting suffix tokens before sending to the model (e.g., ', highly detailed, sharp focus, 8k'). Default: ON for new users
Collapsed inside 'Advanced Options' accordion. Textarea, max 300 chars. Placeholder: 'Things you do NOT want in the image (e.g., blurry, watermark, extra fingers)'
Style presets are visual shortcuts that configure model parameters without exposing technical complexity. Must be displayed as selectable cards with a thumbnail preview image and a label.
FLUX.1-dev; CFG 7; no style LoRA; prompt suffix: 'photorealistic, DSLR, sharp, detailed'
FLUX.1-dev; CFG 8; anime LoRA; prompt suffix: 'anime style, cel shaded, vibrant colors'
FLUX.1-dev; CFG 7.5; digital art LoRA; prompt suffix: 'digital art, concept art, detailed'
SDXL; CFG 8; oil painting LoRA; prompt suffix: 'oil painting, canvas texture, impasto'
FLUX.1-dev; CFG 7; cinematic LoRA; prompt suffix: 'cinematic, film grain, anamorphic, movie still'
SDXL; CFG 6.5; watercolor LoRA; prompt suffix: 'watercolor painting, soft edges, wet on wet'
SDXL; CFG 9; pixel art LoRA; prompt suffix: 'pixel art, 16-bit, retro game style'
FLUX.1-dev; CFG 7; 3D LoRA; prompt suffix: 'octane render, 3D, CGI, physically based'
Displayed as clickable icon-buttons with ratio label. The selected ratio visually changes the output preview frame dimensions.
Integer field, default blank (random). When specified, produces deterministic output from same prompt. Label: 'Seed (leave blank for random)'
Slider from 1–15, default 7. Tooltip: 'Higher = image follows prompt more strictly. Lower = more creative/random'
Segment control: 1 (default) / 2 / 4. Note: 2 images costs 2 credits, 4 costs 4 credits. Warning shown dynamically
Right panel shows placeholder with animated example images cycling every 5 seconds. Generate button is active.
Generate button shows spinner + 'Generating...' text. Button disabled. Credit deducted immediately from display (optimistic update).
Progress bar appears below button. Text: 'In queue... (#2 in line)'. Estimated wait time shown if >10s.
Progress bar animates. Text: 'Creating your image...' + fun rotating micro-copy ('Painting pixels...', 'Waking up the AI...')
Image fades in on right panel. Download button, 'Save to Gallery' button, 'Generate Variations' button appear below image.
Error banner with icon. Specific error message shown (see error codes in 3.9). Credit refunded. 'Try Again' button shown.
After a successful generation, the user sees the following actions beneath the output image:
Downloads the full-resolution PNG. Free tier downloads include watermark. Paid tiers download clean image
Saves the generation (prompt, style, seed, output URL) to the user's personal gallery. Auto-saves for paid users; manual for free
Re-runs the same prompt with seed ±50 to produce 2 similar-but-different outputs. Costs 2 additional credits
One-click transition to the Image Editing screen (Feature 2) with this image pre-loaded
Copies the exact prompt used to clipboard. Useful for iteration
Free tier watermarks must follow these exact specifications to ensure they cannot be easily cropped:
Logo: 'CreativeAI' wordmark in white with 60% opacity
Position: Bottom-right corner AND bottom-left corner (dual placement prevents cropping)
Applied server-side using Sharp.js BEFORE the download URL is generated — never applied client-side
Watermark is NOT applied to in-app preview — only to the downloaded file
Base cost for all image generations
Charged on top of the original generation
Credit consumed; moderation note shown to user
As a user, I want to type a text prompt and receive an AI-generated image, so I can bring my ideas to life without any design skills.
Prompt textarea is visible and focused on page load
Submitting an empty prompt shows validation error 'Please describe what you want to create'
A valid prompt triggers image generation
Generated image appears in the output panel within 30 seconds (P95)
A success notification 'Image created!' appears for 2 seconds
As a user, I want to choose a style preset, so my image matches the visual aesthetic I'm going for without knowing technical parameters.
One preset is always selected (default: Photorealistic)
Clicking a preset card selects it and shows a selected state (colored border)
Selected preset is persisted during the session
The selected preset visually affects the style of the generated output
As a user, I want to choose the aspect ratio of my image, so the output fits the platform I'm creating for.
5 aspect ratio options are displayed as icon-buttons
Selecting a ratio updates the output preview frame shape before generation
The correct resolution is submitted to the AI model based on the selected ratio
As a free tier user, I want to download my image with a watermark, so I can still use the output without paying.
Download button is visible and functional for free users
Downloaded file includes dual watermark (bottom-left and bottom-right)
Watermark is applied server-side before download URL is returned
In-app preview does NOT show the watermark
As a paid user, I want to download a clean image without a watermark, so I can use it professionally.
Spark, Glow, and Pro users receive watermark-free downloads
No watermark processing occurs for paid tier download requests
As a user, I want to see how many credits this action will cost before I click Generate, so I'm never surprised by credit deductions.
Credit cost is displayed adjacent to the Generate button at all times
Cost updates dynamically when 'Number of images' is changed (e.g., '2 credits' for batch of 2)
If user has insufficient credits, the Generate button is disabled and replaced with 'Not enough credits — Upgrade' CTA
As a user, I want to see my generation fail gracefully with a credit refund if the AI API is unavailable, so I don't lose credits for errors outside my control.
API timeout (>30s) or 5xx error triggers a refund
Error banner shows: 'Something went wrong. Your credit has been refunded. Please try again.'
Credit balance is restored within 2 seconds of error detection
As a user, I want my prompt to be enhanced automatically, so my images look better without needing to know prompt engineering.
'Enhance prompt' toggle is ON by default for new users
When ON, the system appends quality tokens to the prompt before submitting to the model
The user's original prompt is preserved in the gallery (not the enhanced version)
User can turn OFF the toggle; preference persists across sessions

Users can edit images — either their own AI generations or uploaded photos — using four one-click editing tools: Background Removal, Basic Inpainting, AI Upscaling, and One-Click Enhancements. Each tool consumes credits.
The Image Editing screen can be accessed in three ways:
Click 'Edit Image' after generating an image (pre-loaded)
Click 'Edit' on any image in the Personal Gallery
Click 'Upload & Edit' from the main navigation — user uploads a JPEG, PNG, or WebP file
8000 × 8000 px (images larger than this are rejected with error message)
Drag-and-drop zone or file picker button. Progress bar shown during upload. File stored temporarily in Supabase Storage under /temp/{userId}/{uuid}.{ext}
Temp files auto-deleted after 24 hours if not saved to gallery

Removes the background from any image, leaving the subject on a transparent background. Output is a PNG with an alpha channel. The user can optionally replace the transparent background with a solid color or a new AI-generated background.
Clipdrop API (/remove-background endpoint) or Replicate BRIA RMBG-2.0 model as fallback
Processing spinner shown over image preview
Result displayed: subject on checkerboard (transparency indicator)
Secondary options appear: 'Keep transparent', 'Add solid color background', 'AI background' (costs +1 credit)
User downloads or saves to gallery

Allows users to mask a region of an image by painting over it with a brush, then describe what should replace that region with a text prompt. The AI fills in only the masked area while keeping the rest of the image intact.
Small (10px), Medium (30px), Large (60px) — selectable via toolbar
Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z undoes the last brush stroke; up to 10 undo levels
'Clear Mask' button resets the entire mask
Pinch-to-zoom on mobile; scroll-to-zoom on desktop; range 50%–300%
Separate text field appears once mask is drawn: 'What should go here?' (max 300 chars)
Full image with masked region replaced; same dimensions as input
Increases image resolution by 2× or 4× while enhancing fine details, sharpness, and reducing artifacts. Useful for users who want to print or use their image at large sizes.
2× (doubles width and height) and 4× (quadruples width and height)
Replicate Real-ESRGAN or Clarity Upscaler model
8000 × 8000 px — if 4× would exceed this, show warning and cap at maximum
Before/after slider is shown after upscaling is complete, allowing the user to drag a divider line to compare the original and upscaled versions side by side.

A set of single-click AI enhancement filters. Each applies a specific transformation to the image. Only one enhancement can be applied per session (to avoid stacking/quality degradation). Cost: 1 credit per enhancement.
Automatically adjusts exposure, contrast, saturation, and sharpness to optimal levels
Smooths skin, brightens eyes, and reduces blemishes on detected faces. Only activates if a face is detected; otherwise shows 'No face detected' message
Converts black-and-white images to color using AI colorization
Stylizes a photograph into a cartoon or illustrated look
Reduces motion blur and sharpens detail in blurry or low-quality images
Replicate deblur model or Sharp.js unsharp mask
Any editing action that fails (API error)
As a user, I want to remove the background from my image with one click, so I can use the subject on a different background.
'Remove Background' button is clearly visible in the editing toolbar
Result shows subject on transparent background (checkerboard pattern)
User can download the PNG with transparency
2 credits are deducted on success; 0 on failure
As a user, I want to paint over part of my image and replace it with something new, so I can fix or change specific areas.
Brush tool is available with 3 sizes
Mask is drawn in semi-transparent red overlay
After drawing mask, a prompt field appears
Undo (up to 10 steps) is functional for mask strokes
As a user, I want to upscale my image to higher resolution, so I can print or use it at a larger size.
2× and 4× upscale options are shown as buttons
Processing indicator is shown during upscaling
Before/after comparison slider appears on completion
Upscaled image can be downloaded at full resolution
Correct credits deducted per selection (2 or 4)
As a user, I want to apply one-click enhancements, so I can improve my image quality without manual editing skills.
5 enhancement options are shown as labeled cards
Clicking one applies the enhancement and shows result
Only one enhancement can be applied per editing session
'No face detected' message shown if Face Retouch selected on non-portrait image
As a user, I want to upload my own photo to edit, so I can use the editing tools on images I already have.
File size limit of 20MB enforced with clear error message
Uploaded image is displayed in the editing canvas within 3 seconds
Uploaded image persists for 24 hours in temp storage

Users can animate any image (AI-generated or uploaded) into a 3–5 second video clip. The animation is driven by a motion prompt describing the movement. Output is an MP4 video optimized for social media. Free tier cannot access video; Spark and above can.

Free tier users who navigate to the Video tool see a locked state UI with: a blurred/dimmed example video preview, the message 'Video creation is available on Spark and above', and a prominent 'Upgrade to Spark — $5/mo' CTA button.
User navigates to 'Video' section from main navigation
User selects source image: from gallery, from current generation, or by uploading new image
User types a motion prompt (max 150 chars) — describes the movement (see presets in 5.3)
User selects clip duration: 3 seconds or 5 seconds
User clicks 'Animate' — credit cost shown: 5 credits for 3s, 8 credits for 5s
Completed video plays automatically in-app in a looping video player
User can download as MP4 or save to gallery
The motion prompt field accepts free-text input AND offers one-click preset buttons that populate the field:
Slow cinematic zoom into the center of the image
Slow cinematic pull back revealing more of the scene
Smooth horizontal pan from right to left
Smooth horizontal pan from left to right
Gentle upward drift, clouds moving, light shimmer
Subtle pulsing breathing effect on the subject
Handheld camera shake effect, documentary feel
Flickering fire and heat distortion applied to image
Replicate Stability AI Stable Video Diffusion (SVD-XT) or Kling Video API — chosen based on cost-per-second and output quality at time of implementation
Fal.ai AnimateDiff-Lightning if primary is unavailable
Source image is resized/cropped to 1024×576 (16:9) or 576×1024 (9:16) before submission, preserving aspect ratio with letterboxing if needed
MP4, H.264 codec, AAC audio stream (silent), bitrate 4–8 Mbps
Video generation is asynchronous. Backend polls the generation API every 5 seconds and pushes status updates to the frontend via Supabase Realtime
Available on Spark, Glow, Pro only
Available on Spark, Glow, Pro only
Upgrade CTA shown; no credits consumed
As a paid user, I want to animate my AI-generated image into a short video clip, so I can post more engaging content on social media.
Video section is accessible and unlocked for Spark, Glow, Pro users
User can select source image from gallery or current generation
Motion prompt field and presets are shown
Clicking 'Animate' triggers generation with correct credit cost shown
Completed video plays in-app in a looping player
As a free user, I want to understand that video is a paid feature before I waste time trying to use it, so I'm not confused.
Video nav item shows a lock icon for free users
Clicking the locked video section shows upgrade prompt — not an error
Upgrade CTA clearly states the price ($5/mo)
No credits are consumed for visiting the locked screen
As a user, I want one-click motion presets, so I don't have to know how to describe camera movements technically.
Clicking a preset populates the motion prompt field with correct text
User can still edit the populated text freely
Preset selection persists until user changes it
As a user, I want to see a real-time progress indicator during video generation, so I'm not left wondering if something went wrong.
Processing screen shows animated spinner + 'Animating...' message
If generation takes >120 seconds, message updates to 'Taking a bit longer than usual...'
If generation fails, error shown with credit refund confirmation

The Template Library is a curated collection of 50+ pre-designed creation starting points. Each template bundles a prompt, style preset, and aspect ratio into a one-click launcher. Templates remove the 'blank page' problem for users who don't know where to start.
Short display title, max 40 chars (e.g., 'Cozy Coffee Shop Portrait')
Category: social_post | thumbnail | wallpaper | avatar | artistic | seasonal
URL of a pre-generated example output stored in CDN
Full prompt text pre-loaded into the generation prompt field
Optional negative prompt bundled with the template
Name of the style preset applied (must match one of the 8 in Section 3.3)
Default aspect ratio for the template (must match one of the 5 in Section 3.4)
If true, shown in 'Featured' row at top of library
If true, available to all tiers; if false, Spark and above only
When the template was added to the library
Instagram Quote Card, TikTok Thumbnail, Twitter Header, LinkedIn Banner
Gaming Thumbnail, Vlog Cover, Tutorial Thumbnail, Reaction Face
Neon City Wallpaper, Forest Dawn Desktop, Abstract Gradient, Lo-Fi Bedroom
Anime Avatar, Pixel Art Profile Pic, Fantasy Portrait, Chibi Character
Oil Painting Landscape, Watercolor Botanicals, Retro Poster, Surreal Scene
Birthday Card, Holiday Greeting, Valentine's Art, New Year Celebration
Grid layout, responsive — 4 columns on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile
Thumbnail image fills the card; template title overlaid at bottom in semi-transparent bar; category badge top-left; lock icon top-right for paid-only templates on free tier
Horizontal scrollable 'Featured' row (3–5 templates); search bar; category filter tabs below
Full-text search across template title and category; results filter the grid in real-time (client-side, no API call)
All | Social Posts | Thumbnails | Wallpapers | Avatars | Artistic | Seasonal
Card lifts (shadow increase); 'Use Template →' overlay CTA appears
User clicks a template card ('Use Template →')
System navigates to Image Generation screen
Prompt field is pre-populated with the template's prompt
Style preset is auto-selected to match the template
Aspect ratio is auto-selected to match the template
Generate button is prominent — user can tweak or generate immediately
User can modify any pre-filled values freely before generating
Generating from a template costs standard image generation credits (1 credit per image). No additional template fee.
Can access and use templates marked is_free = true. Locked templates show lock icon and upgrade prompt when clicked
New templates are added by admin only via a seeded database migration or admin-only Supabase dashboard — no user-generated templates in Phase 1
As a user who doesn't know what to create, I want a library of starting-point templates, so I can get inspired and start creating immediately.
Template library is accessible from main navigation
At least 50 templates are present at launch
Templates are organized into categories with filter tabs
Clicking a template pre-populates the generation screen
No additional credits charged for using a template
As a user, I want to search for templates by keyword, so I can quickly find relevant ones.
Search bar is visible above the template grid
Searching 'birthday' returns templates with 'birthday' in title or category
Empty search state shows 'No templates found for...' with a clear search button
As a free tier user, I want to know which templates require a paid plan before I click them, so I'm not surprised.
Paid-only templates show a lock icon on the card
Clicking a locked template shows upgrade prompt, not an error
Free templates have no lock icon and work immediately

The Personal Gallery is each user's private cloud storage of all their past creations. Every generation (image and video) is saved here. Users can browse, re-download, delete, organize into collections, and jump back into editing from the gallery.
CDN URL of the generated/edited file
CDN URL of a 400×400 compressed thumbnail for gallery display
The original user prompt (not the enhanced version)
Name/version of AI model that produced this output
Seed used for generation; enables exact reproduction
Whether user has starred/favorited this item
Optional foreign key to collections table (nullable)
Manual — user must click 'Save to Gallery'
Items retained for 60 days since last download; then flagged for deletion with 7-day warning email
Masonry grid (Pinterest-style) — items flow naturally based on aspect ratio; 4 columns desktop, 2 tablet, 1 mobile
Newest first (default) | Oldest first | Favorites first
Client-side search by prompt text — filters visible items in real-time
Thumbnail fills card; on hover: title (prompt truncated to 40 chars), date, action icons (Download, Edit, Favorite, Delete)
Checkbox appears on long-press (mobile) or right-click (desktop); bulk download (as ZIP) and bulk delete actions
Clicking a gallery item opens a modal detail view containing:
Full-resolution image preview (or video player for clips)
Metadata: style preset, aspect ratio, seed, model, date created
Action bar: Download, Edit (opens in editing screen), Generate Variations (costs 2 credits), Delete, Copy Prompt
'Recreate' button — re-runs the exact same generation (same prompt, style, seed) — costs 1 credit
Users can organize gallery items into named collections (like folders):
Via 'New Collection' button in gallery sidebar; name max 40 chars
Drag-and-drop item onto collection name, or right-click → 'Add to Collection' → pick from list
Free: 3 collections; Spark: 10; Glow: 25; Pro: unlimited
All items not in a collection appear in 'All Creations' (the default view)
As a user, I want all my creations saved automatically, so I never lose my work.
All image generations auto-save to gallery for Spark, Glow, Pro users
Free users see a 'Save to Gallery' button after each generation
Successfully saved items appear in gallery within 5 seconds
Gallery item count is updated in the navigation badge
As a user, I want to re-download any past creation at any time, so I can retrieve images I forgot to save locally.
Every gallery item has a 'Download' action
Download retrieves the original full-resolution file (with or without watermark based on plan at time of generation)
Download triggers immediately with no loading delay (CDN-served)
As a user, I want to organize my creations into collections, so I can find specific images quickly.
'New Collection' button creates a named folder
Items can be added to collections
Clicking a collection filters the gallery to show only its contents
Collections are shown in a sidebar on desktop
As a user, I want to delete creations I no longer want, so my gallery stays tidy.
Delete action is available per item (with confirmation dialog)
Bulk delete is available after bulk-selecting items
Deleted items are permanently removed (no recycle bin in Phase 1)
Gallery item count updates immediately after deletion
As a user, I want to jump from gallery back into editing any image, so I can continue working on past creations.
'Edit' action on gallery item opens the editing screen with that image pre-loaded
Transition is seamless with no re-upload required

Credits are the internal currency of CreativeAI. Every generation and editing action costs credits. The system is transparent — users always know their balance and cost before acting. Credits roll over (unused credits carry to next month). This is the primary differentiator vs. all 7 competitors.
❌ No rollover — resets to 25 each month

*Pro plan is metered — there is a soft limit of 2,000 images and 120 videos per month before rate limiting kicks in. In Phase 1, the soft limit is not enforced; all Pro generations succeed. Rate limiting to be implemented in Phase 2.
The credit balance must be visible at all times in the application. Placement and behavior:
Top navigation bar, right side, adjacent to the user avatar — always visible
Shows breakdown: 'Monthly credits: 120 | Rollover from last month: 27 | Total: 147'
When balance falls below 20 credits, the display changes to amber color and a subtle pulse animation
Display turns red; all Generate / Edit buttons show disabled state with tooltip 'No credits remaining — top up or upgrade'
Balance updates immediately (optimistic) when an action is triggered and confirmed when the API responds
Before any credit-consuming action is triggered, the cost must be shown to the user. Rules:
Cost is displayed adjacent to the primary action button at all times (not just on hover)
Format: '⚡ 1 credit' or '⚡ 3 credits' — always in this format, never 'costs 1 credit'
When batch count changes (1/2/4 images), cost updates dynamically in real-time
When user has insufficient credits, the button is disabled and the cost label changes to red with 'Need more credits'
Every credit transaction is logged in a 'credit_transactions' table for auditability:
User's credit balance after this transaction
ID of the gallery item or Stripe charge this transaction relates to
Via 'Get More Credits' button in the credit display tooltip, or via Account Settings → Credits tab
$2 = 20 credits (free tier) / 30 credits (paid tiers); $5 = 60 credits (free) / 80 credits (paid); $10 = 140 credits (free) / 180 credits (paid)
Processed via Stripe one-time payment (not a subscription charge)
Credits added to account within 5 seconds of successful Stripe webhook receipt
Top-up credits never expire — they accumulate with rollover credits
The following logic runs on each billing cycle event (triggered by Stripe subscription renewal webhook or, for free users, a daily cron job on the 1st of each month):
Calculate unused credits from the current cycle: unused = credits_remaining - rollover_balance_at_cycle_start
For FREE tier: set credits_remaining = 25 (hard reset, no rollover). Insert credit_transaction record type = 'monthly_grant'
For PAID tiers: add this month's credit_monthly_allowance to the existing balance. Insert credit_transaction type = 'monthly_grant' for the new grant AND type = 'rollover' for the carried-over amount
Send 'Your credits have been refreshed' in-app notification
AI API returns 5xx error; generation times out (>60s for images, >180s for videos); explicit model error (not content policy violation)
Exact number of credits deducted for the failed action
Within 3 seconds of error detection; optimistic UI update followed by server confirmation
NOT refunded — 1 credit is consumed when a generation is blocked for NSFW or content policy violation. A clear message explains this to the user
Every refund creates a credit_transactions record with type = 'refund' and references the original transaction's reference_id
As a user, I want to always see my credit balance, so I know when I'm running low.
Credit balance visible in top nav at all times
Balance shows total (monthly + rollover + top-up) as a single number
Tooltip on hover breaks down the sources of credits
Balance turns amber below 20, red at 0
As a user, I want to know the credit cost before I click Generate, so I'm never surprised.
Cost shown next to every action button at all times
Cost updates in real-time when batch count changes
Button disabled with red cost label when insufficient credits
As a paid user, I want my unused credits to roll over each month, so I don't lose credits I didn't get to use.
Unused credits from current cycle carry forward to next month
Rollover credits are added to new cycle grant (not replacing it)
Credit transaction record of type 'rollover' is created at cycle renewal
Total balance increases by both rollover amount and new monthly grant
As a user, I want my credits refunded if a generation fails, so I don't pay for errors.
Credits refunded within 3 seconds of confirmed API error
In-app notification: 'Generation failed. 1 credit has been refunded'
Credit transaction record of type 'refund' created
Balance updates immediately in the UI
As a user, I want to buy extra credits without upgrading my plan, so I can use more without committing to a higher tier.
'Get More Credits' CTA accessible from credit tooltip and Account Settings
3 top-up package sizes are shown with clear pricing
Credits appear in account within 5 seconds of payment

All UI implementation must follow this design system precisely. Deviations require design review. These specs directly counter the dark/cold aesthetic of all 7 competitors and establish our differentiated visual identity.
Primary CTA buttons, selected states, active nav items — warm orange-amber
Light background tint for primary elements, callout boxes
Secondary actions, links, info badges — sky blue for contrast
Main app background — warm off-white, never pure white
Slightly warmer card variant for alternating rows
Metadata, labels, helper text — warm gray
Credit cost display — purple to distinguish from action colors
All fonts are loaded from Google Fonts. Add display=swap parameter. Preload the Inter and Nunito font families in the HTML <head>.
4px — all spacing values are multiples of 4
Small components (badges, inputs): 6px. Cards: 12px. Modals: 16px. Buttons: 8px. Pill badges: 9999px
shadow-sm: 0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.05); shadow-md: 0 4px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.07); shadow-lg: 0 10px 15px rgba(0,0,0,0.10)
320px fixed width on desktop; full-width on mobile
The main navigation is a fixed left sidebar on desktop (240px wide) and a bottom tab bar on mobile (5 tabs). Items:
Web application — all UI screens and client-side logic
REST API for all frontend-to-backend communication
All relational data: users, gallery, credit transactions, templates
Temporary upload storage for user-uploaded images
Long-term storage and global CDN delivery of all generated outputs
Image and video generation model inference
Subscription billing, one-time top-ups, customer portal
Product analytics, funnel tracking, feature flags
All of the following must be configured in both .env.local (development) and Vercel environment variables (production):
Backend only — NEVER exposed to client
All tables below must be created in Supabase (PostgreSQL). Row-Level Security (RLS) must be enabled on all tables. Users may only read/write their own rows.
Extended user profile and subscription data
Users can SELECT/UPDATE their own row only. Service role can UPDATE all rows (for cron jobs)
Users can SELECT/INSERT/DELETE their own rows only
Immutable ledger of all credit changes
Users can SELECT their own rows. INSERT/UPDATE only by service role
All authenticated users can SELECT. Only service role can INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE
Users can SELECT/INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE their own rows only
Track async generation requests and their status
Users can SELECT their own rows. Service role manages INSERT/UPDATE
Image and video generation is handled asynchronously. The following sequence must be implemented exactly:
Frontend sends POST /api/generate with prompt, style, ratio, user JWT

Backend validates JWT → checks credits → deducts credits optimistically (UPDATE users SET credits_remaining = credits_remaining - cost) → creates generation_jobs row with status = 'pending' → returns {job_id, estimated_wait_seconds} to frontend
Backend triggers Replicate/Fal.ai API call asynchronously (do not await in the HTTP request cycle)
Frontend subscribes to Supabase Realtime on the generation_jobs row for the returned job_id
Replicate/Fal.ai webhook OR backend polling updates generation_jobs.status to 'processing' then 'complete' or 'failed'
On 'complete': backend uploads output file to Cloudflare R2 → creates gallery_items row → updates generation_jobs.status = 'complete' + output_url
Supabase Realtime pushes status change to frontend → frontend fetches and displays the output image

On 'failed': backend restores credits (UPDATE users SET credits_remaining = credits_remaining + cost) → creates credit_transactions refund record → updates generation_jobs.status = 'failed' → Realtime pushes error to frontend
All endpoints are served from the Next.js API routes at /api/*. All endpoints except /api/webhooks/* require a valid Supabase JWT in the Authorization: Bearer {token} header. All responses are JSON.
Authentication is handled directly by Supabase Auth client-side. No custom auth API routes are needed for login/signup/logout. The frontend uses the @supabase/ssr package.
{ prompt: string, style: string, aspectRatio: string, count: 1|2|4, seed?: number, negativePrompt?: string, enhancePrompt: boolean }
{ jobId: string, creditsCost: number, creditsRemaining: number, estimatedSeconds: number }
Validates credits, deducts optimistically, triggers async generation
{ status: 'pending'|'processing'|'complete'|'failed', outputUrl?: string, thumbnailUrl?: string, error?: string }
Poll fallback if Realtime is unavailable
Generates 2 variations using seed ±50 from original
{ imageUrl: string } OR multipart: { file: File }
{ imageUrl: string, maskUrl: string, prompt: string }
maskUrl is a pre-uploaded PNG mask from /api/upload/mask
{ jobId: string, creditsCost: number, creditsRemaining: number }
{ tempUrl: string, width: number, height: number, sizeBytes: number }
Uploads to Supabase temp storage. Max 20MB. Returns temp URL valid 24hrs
Uploads inpainting mask PNG to temp storage
{ jobId: string, creditsCost: number, creditsRemaining: number, estimatedSeconds: number }
duration 3 = 5 credits, duration 5 = 8 credits. Blocked for Free tier (returns 403)
{ status: string, videoUrl?: string, thumbnailUrl?: string, error?: string }
{ items: GalleryItem[], total: number, page: number, hasMore: boolean }
Update favorite status or collection assignment
Permanently deletes item and CDN file
Bulk deletion — max 50 items per request
Watermark applied server-side for free users before redirect
{ total: number, monthly: number, rollover: number, topup: number }
Creates Stripe one-time payment checkout session. Frontend redirects to checkoutUrl
Creates Stripe Customer Portal session for plan management
Creates Stripe subscription checkout session for upgrades
Returns templates; locked templates include is_free=false for client to handle UI
User's credit balance is below the cost of the requested action
You don't have enough credits for this. Top up or upgrade your plan.
Action (e.g., video) is not available on user's current plan
This feature requires a paid plan. Upgrade to unlock it.
AI model blocked the prompt for NSFW or policy reasons
Your prompt was flagged by our content filter. 1 credit has been used. Please revise your prompt.
AI API did not respond within the timeout window
Generation timed out. Your credit has been refunded. Please try again.
AI API returned a non-recoverable error
Something went wrong. Your credit has been refunded. Please try again.
File is too large. Maximum file size is 20MB.
Uploaded file is not JPEG, PNG, or WebP
Unsupported file type. Please upload a JPEG, PNG, or WebP image.
Free user has hit 50-item gallery limit
Your gallery is full (50/50). Delete some items or upgrade to save more.
User has sent too many requests in a short time
You're generating too fast! Please wait a moment and try again.
99.5% monthly uptime — maximum 3.6 hours downtime per month
If Replicate.com returns errors for >3 consecutive requests, auto-switch to Fal.ai for the next 5 minutes
Supabase provides 99.9% SLA — acceptable for Phase 1
Supabase daily backups enabled. Cloudflare R2 has built-in redundancy
Vercel handles this automatically via its deployment pipeline
All API routes validate Supabase JWT on every request. JWTs expire after 1 hour; auto-refreshed by Supabase client
Supabase RLS enabled on all tables — users cannot access other users' data even with valid JWT
All third-party API keys stored as environment variables; never committed to version control; never returned to the client
All API inputs validated using Zod schema validation before processing. Invalid inputs return 400 with specific error messages
IP-based rate limiting: 60 requests per minute per IP on all /api/* routes using Vercel Edge Middleware
All prompts run through a moderation check (OpenAI Moderation API or equivalent) before submission to generation APIs. Flagged prompts are rejected with CONTENT_POLICY_VIOLATION error
Enforced on all routes by Vercel. HTTP requests redirected to HTTPS
API routes only accept requests from the production and staging frontend origins
Stripe webhook signature verified using Stripe SDK on every incoming webhook
All API routes are stateless serverless functions — scale horizontally automatically on Vercel
Use Supabase connection pooling (PgBouncer) to prevent connection exhaustion
If daily generation volume exceeds 5,000, introduce a Redis-based queue (Upstash) — not needed at launch
Cloudflare R2 has no practical storage limit — scales without intervention
All UI components must meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA
All interactive elements reachable and operable via keyboard (Tab, Enter, Space, Arrow keys)
All images have descriptive alt text. ARIA labels on icon-only buttons. Live regions for generation status updates
All text meets minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio against its background
Visible focus ring on all interactive elements (2px solid color-primary)
All of the following testing types are mandatory before any feature is marked 'complete' and merged to main:
All utility functions, credit calculation logic, prompt validation, and Zod schemas. Coverage target: 80%
All /api/* routes tested with mock AI API responses. Every endpoint's success path, auth failure path, and error path must be tested
Playwright E2E tests for the 5 critical user flows listed in 13.2. Run on every pull request via CI
Percy or Chromatic snapshots for all key screens. Any visual change must be explicitly approved
13.2 Critical E2E Test Scenarios (Must Pass Before Launch)
New user sign-up and first generation
1. Visit landing page 2. Click 'Get Started Free' 3. Sign up with email 4. Complete onboarding 5. Type prompt and click Generate
Image generated and displayed within 30s. Credit balance shows 24.
1. Sign in as free user with 0 credits 2. Click 'Upgrade' CTA 3. Complete Stripe checkout (test card) 4. Return to app
Plan shows 'Spark'. Credit balance shows 150. Video section is unlocked.
1. Sign in as paid user 2. Mock Replicate API to return 500 3. Submit generation 4. Wait for error state
Credit balance restored. Error message shown. Refund credit transaction created in DB.
1. Generate an image 2. Click 'Edit' 3. Select 'Background Removal' 4. Wait for result 5. Download
Background removed. Download produces PNG with transparency. 2 credits deducted.
1. Navigate to Templates 2. Click a template 3. Verify generation screen is pre-populated 4. Click Generate
Prompt, style, and aspect ratio match template. Image generates successfully.
A feature is only considered done and ready for production deployment when ALL of the following are true:
All user stories for the feature have acceptance criteria verified by QA
All API endpoints for the feature have integration tests passing
E2E tests for the feature pass in CI on a staging environment
The feature has been manually tested by the Product Owner on the staging environment
No P0 or P1 bugs are open for this feature
Error states and edge cases have been tested (empty states, network failures, invalid inputs)
Accessibility check passed (keyboard navigation + screen reader + contrast ratio verified)
All environment variables required by the feature are documented in the .env.example file
— End of PRD v1.0 — CreativeAI Phase 1 MVP —
This document is confidential and intended for the product development team only.
